hook.text: Beginners choose plants for flowers. Experts choose plants for foliage. Flowers last weeks. Leaves last months.

buildup.text: Foliage provides color, texture, and structure for the entire growing seasonâ€”not just a brief flowering window.

discovery.text: Purple leaves, silver foliage, variegated shrubs, and bronze grasses provide months of color with no blooms.

twist.text: The most photographed gardens rely 70% on foliage effects and only 30% on flowers. Leaves are the real design backbone.

climax.text: Designing with foliage first, then adding flowers, creates gardens that look good for monthsâ€”not just during peak bloom.

punchline.text: Design for leaves first. Flowers are the bonus.

quiz.question: Why do expert designers prioritize foliage over flowers?
options: Foliage plants are always cheaper and more available than flowering plants
Foliage provides color and structure for months while flowers last only weeks
Flowers attract too many pests and require more maintenance than foliage
